com.namics.oss.spring.support.i18n.excel

Class ExcelWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.namics.oss.spring.support.i18n.excel.ExcelWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Excel

    public class ExcelWriter
extends Object
implements Excel
    Util class that uses apache poi library to write an excel resource file in namics format. The excel sheet may contain several sheets. Each sheet of the file will have the default form:
    • Line 1 (Header): KEY | de | fr | more iso-language-codes ...
    • Line 2..n (Values): message.key | Deutsch | Francaise | other translation
    The header columns are defined by the provided languages in the resources lists. The concrete row and column numbers can be configured to match more requirements like comments.
    Since:
    Namics commons i18n 1.0 - Oct 18, 2010
    Author:
    aschaefer, namics ag

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExcelWriter

        public ExcelWriter()
        Constructor to create writer for default excel layout.

      • ExcelWriter

        public ExcelWriter(int languageHeaderRow,
                   int keyColumn,
                   int firstLanguageColumn)
        Constructor to create a writer for a customized excel. You can use the DEFAULT_* constants to set defaults for certain values.
        Parameters:
        languageHeaderRow - defines the row number in the sheet that defines the header (default:0, first row).
        keyColumn - defines the column that is used for the message code (default:0, the first column).
        firstLanguageColumn - defines the first column used for languages (default:1, second column).

    • Method Detail

      • createExcel

        public void createExcel(List<MessageResourceEntry> input,
                        File output,
                        String format)
                 throws I18nException
        Creates an excel file to export message data. The excel workbook will have one sheet. Each sheet of the file will have the default form:
        • Line 1 (Header): KEY | de | fr | more iso-language-codes ...
        • Line 2..n (Values): message.key | Deutsch | Francaise | other translation
        The header columns are defined by the provided languages in the resources lists. The concrete row and column numbers can be configured to match more requirements like comments.
        Parameters:
        input - a list of message information to write to excel
        output - file to create output in.
        format - use constants FORMAT_EXCEL_97 or FORMAT_EXCEL_2007
        Throws:
        I18nException - if a problem occures

      • createExcel

        public void createExcel(List<MessageResourceEntry> input,
                        OutputStream output,
                        String format)
                 throws I18nException
        Creates an excel file to export message data. The excel workbook will have one sheet. Each sheet of the file will have the default form:
        • Line 1 (Header): KEY | de | fr | more iso-language-codes ...
        • Line 2..n (Values): message.key | Deutsch | Francaise | other translation
        The header columns are defined by the provided languages in the resources lists. The concrete row and column numbers can be configured to match more requirements like comments.
        Parameters:
        input - a list of message information to write to excel
        output - if you want to create xls (Excel 97-2003) files, DO NOT use BufferedOutputStream due to library issue.
        format - use constants FORMAT_EXCEL_97 or FORMAT_EXCEL_2007
        Throws:
        I18nException - if a problem occures

      • createExcel

        public void createExcel(Map<String,List<MessageResourceEntry>> input,
                        File output,
                        String format)
                 throws I18nException
        Creates an excel file to export message data. The excel workbook will have several sheets named after the map key. Each sheet of the file will have the default form:
        • Line 1 (Header): KEY | de | fr | more iso-language-codes ...
        • Line 2..n (Values): message.key | Deutsch | Francaise | other translation
        The header columns are defined by the provided languages in the resources lists. The concrete row and column numbers can be configured to match more requirements like comments.
        Parameters:
        input - a list of message information to write to excel
        output - file to create output in.
        format - use constants FORMAT_EXCEL_97 or FORMAT_EXCEL_2007
        Throws:
        I18nException - if a problem occures

      • createExcel

        public void createExcel(Map<String,List<MessageResourceEntry>> input,
                        OutputStream output,
                        String format)
                 throws I18nException
        Creates an excel file to export message data. The excel workbook will have several sheets named after the map key. Each sheet of the file will have the default form:
        • Line 1 (Header): KEY | de | fr | more iso-language-codes ...
        • Line 2..n (Values): message.key | Deutsch | Francaise | other translation
        The header columns are defined by the provided languages in the resources lists. The concrete row and column numbers can be configured to match more requirements like comments.
        Parameters:
        input - a list of message information to write to excel
        output - if you want to create xls (Excel 97-2003) files, DO NOT use BufferedOutputStream due to library issue.
        format - use constants FORMAT_EXCEL_97 or FORMAT_EXCEL_2007
        Throws:
        I18nException - if a problem occures
